availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis M. Chandler (Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and trader)

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and trader. Kentucky native. Son of David Chandler and Drucilla Chandler. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Trader in Webster County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 138B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 729.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 614.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 486A.
